content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="fgdc_classic.xsl"?> <metadata xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://water.usgs.gov/GIS/metadata/usgswrd/fgdc-std-001-1998.xsd">  <idinfo>   <citation>    <citeinfo>     <origin>Alan Rea</origin>     <origin>Kenneth D. Skinner</origin>     <pubdate>2012</pubdate>     <title>Statewide datasets for Hawaii StreamStats</title>     <geoform>raster and vector digital data</geoform>     <pubinfo>      <pubplace>Reston, VA</pubplace>      <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish>     </pubinfo>     <onlink>http://water.usgs.gov/lookup/getspatial?ds680_statewidelayers</onlink>     <lworkcit>      <citeinfo>       <origin>Alan Rea</origin>       <origin>Kenneth D. Skinner</origin>       <pubdate>2012</pubdate>       <title>Geospatial Datasets for Watershed Delineation and Characterization used in the Hawaii StreamStats Web Application</title>       <geoform>raster and vector digital data</geoform>       <serinfo>        <sername>U.S. Geological Survey Data Series</sername>        <issue>680</issue>       </serinfo>       <pubinfo>        <pubplace>Reston, Virginia</pubplace>        <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish>       </pubinfo>       <onlink>http://pubs.usgs.gov/ds/680/</onlink>      </citeinfo>     </lworkcit>    </citeinfo>   </citation>   <descript>    <abstract> This dataset consists of a workspace (folder) containing 41 gridded datasets and a personal geodatabase. The gridded datasets consist of 28 precipitation-frequency grids, a mean annual precipitation grid,  eight land cover grids, two soil permeability grids, a synthetic stream grid, and a region grid used in the Hawaii StreamStats application for peak flow estimates. The personal geodatabase contains a polygon feature class of exclusion polygons, which identify areas in which use the StreamStats application is restricted. </abstract>    <purpose>  These datasets were produced to support the StreamStats application for Hawaii.  The precipitation, land cover, and soil permeability grids are used to compute  those characteristics for basins that have been edited by the user within the  StreamStats web application. The same grids were used to compute continuous  parameter grids. The continuous parameter grids are distributed with the ArcHydroHUC  data sets for each 8-digit HUC, and are used in characteristic computations for unedited basins.  The region grid is used to identify which regional regression equations to apply  for estimating streamflow statistics in Hawaii. The exclusion polygons are used to  restrict or prevent use of the StreamStats application in areas where results may be  invalid, or where its use is to be prevented for various reasons. </purpose>    <supplinf> Each compressed download  file (with a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.zip\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd extension) contains the  version information in the filename in the form of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdVnn,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd where \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdnn\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd  is the data version number. In this manner, each data component may be  versioned and distributed independently. The data is distributed in  \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.zip\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd files, one per 8-digit HUC, plus one \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.zip\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd file for the  ArcHydro Global dataset, one for the statewide layers, and one for the  original data. For example, the file \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdDS680_20020000_V01.zip\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd would  contain the entire folder for HUC 20020000 (Maui). A file named  \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdDS680_20020000_V02.zip\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd would indicate that data have been updated,  and that version 02 data should be used. If a change to one dataset  results in the need to change others, all affected datasets will be  updated, and the data distribution site will be maintained so it  includes a complete set of compatible dataset versions.  Each \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.zip\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd file includes a text file (like this one) that indicates  the version of the accompanying data component. For example, the  \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdDS680_20020000_V02.zip\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd file would contain a file named  \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdDS680_20020000_V02.txt,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd which will extract into the archydro\\20020000  folder. The name of this file will indicate the version of the data in  the folder. The file itself contains an explanation of the versioning  system, and a summary of edits made since the first version of the  dataset was released.  To replace an old version with a newer version, the old version of the data component should be deleted, following the example below, before the new version is extracted into its place.   Example instructions for updating data components from geospatial datasets:  --------------------------------------------------------------------------- Component           Delete prior to extracting new version of ".zip" file --------------------------------------------------------------------------- ArcHydroGlobal      D:\\data\\hi_ss\\archydro\\global.mdb StatewideLayers     D:\\data\\hi_ss\\statewide\\ (delete entire folder) Huc#                D:\\data\\hi_ss\\archydro\\Huc# (delete entire folder) ---------------------------------------------------------------------------  where HUC# is the 8-digit Hydrologic Unit Code and D:\\data\\hi_ss\\ is the disk  location where ZIP file archives were extracted. </supplinf>   </descript>   <timeperd>    <timeinfo>     <sngdate>      <caldate>2012</caldate>     </sngdate>    </timeinfo>    <current>publication date</current>   </timeperd>   <status> for the islands of Hawaii, Maui, Molokai, Oahu, and Kauai. Other islands are not included. Coastlines are as defined by the NHD.</complete>   <lineage>    <srcinfo>     <srccite>      <citeinfo>       <origin>U.S. Geological Survey</origin>       <pubdate>20030901</pubdate> precipitation isohyets</srccontr>    </srcinfo>    <srcinfo>     <srccite>      <citeinfo>       <origin>NOAA/NWS/Office of Hydrologic Development, Hydrometeorological Design Studies Center</origin>       <pubdate>20090529</pubdate>       <title>NOAA Atlas 14, Volume 4, Version 2 Gridded Precipitation Frequency Estimates for the Hawaiian Islands</title>       <geoform>raster digital data</geoform>       <pubinfo>        <pubplace> Silver Spring, MD, USA  </pubplace>        <publish>NOAA/NWS/Office of Hydrologic Development, Hydrometeorological Design Studies Center</publish>       </pubinfo>       <othercit>grid-cell resolution 15 sec (approximately 450 meters)</othercit>       <onlink>http://hdsc.nws.noaa.gov/hdsc/pfds/</onlink>      </citeinfo>     </srccite>     <typesrc>online</typesrc>     <srctime>      <timeinfo>       <rngdates>        <begdate>18990101</begdate>        <enddate>20051231</enddate>       </rngdates>      </timeinfo>      <srccurr>Climatological period from which the point precipitation observations were taken</srccurr>     </srctime>     <srccitea>pf_precip</srccitea>     <srccontr>Precipitation Frequency grids</srccontr>    </srcinfo>    <procstep>     <procdesc>The precipitation frequency grids were projected to UTM. Later the grids were expanded  by two grid cells, using the focalmean function to ensure the islands were completely covered by  the precipitation-frequency grids. </procdesc>     <srcused>pf_precip</srcused>     <procdate>20100823</procdate>     <srcprod>precip_pf_grids</srcprod>    </procstep>    <procstep>     <procdesc> The NLCD2001 land-cover grid was classified into several separate grids for different  land-cover categories, with the result grids having cell value 1 for every cell in the category,  and having cell value 0 everywhere else. The statewide grids created were as follows:  >nlcd012122 Developed Open Space and Low Intensity Developed Land from NLCD2001 (classes 21 and 22) >nlcd01_23 Medium Intensity Developed Land from NLCD2001 (class 23) >nlcd01_24 High Intensity Developed Land from NLCD2001 (class 24) >nlcd01_31 Barren Land from NLCD2001 (class 31) >nlcd01_42 Evergreen Forest Land from NLCD2001 (class 42) >nlcd01_82 Cultivated Crop Land from NLCD2001 (class 82) >urbnlcd01 Urban Land from NLCD2001 (classes 21, 22, 23, and 24) </procdesc>     <srcused>NLCD2001</srcused>     <procdate>2009</procdate>     <srcprod>nlcd_grids</srcprod>    </procstep>   </lineage>  </dataqual>  <spdoinfo>   <indspref>There is one vector polygon data set and forty-one raster data sets, covering the five largest islands of Hawaii included within this download</indspref>  </spdoinfo>  <spref>   <horizsys>    <planar>     <gridsys>      <gridsysn>Universal Transverse Mercator</gridsysn>      <utm> System 80</ellips>     <semiaxis>6378137.000000</semiaxis>     <denflat>298.257222</denflat>    </geodetic>   </horizsys>  </spref>  <eainfo>   <overview>    <eaover> Statewide data sets:  >hi2yr60ma Value 1 if in these categories, 0 otherwise. (1/0 grid) >nlcd01_23 Medium Intensity Developed Land from NLCD2001, (1/0 grid) >nlcd01_24 High Intensity Developed Land from NLCD2001, (1/0 grid) >nlcd01_31 Barren Land from NLCD2001, (1/0 grid) >nlcd01_42 Evergreen Forest Land from NLCD2001, (1/0 grid) >nlcd01_82 Cultivated Crop Land from NLCD2001, (1/0 grid) >perm12in Area-weighted mean soil permeability (top 12 inches), in inches per hour (NRCS SSURGO database) >perm24in Area-weighted mean soil permeability (top 24 inches), in inches per hour (NRCS SSURGO database) >precip_1k_in Mean annual precipitation, in thousandths of an inch >urbnlcd01 Urban Land from NLCD2001, (1/0 grid) >hi_pkreg Grid of peak-flow regression regions >str900 Grid of synthetic streams based on a 900-cell flow-accumulation threshold >ExcludePolys Polygon providing informational warning regarding watershed delineations in an irrigated area  See USGS Data Series Report DS680 for complete information. </eaover>    <eadetcit> See Entity_and_Attribute_Overview section. </eadetcit>   </overview>  </eainfo>  <distinfo>   <distrib>    <cntinfo>     <cntorgp>      <cntorg>U.S. Geological Survey</cntorg>     </cntorgp>     <cntpos>Ask USGS -- Water Webserver Team</cntpos>     <cntaddr>      <addrtype>mailing address</addrtype>      <address>445 National Center</address>      <city>Reston</city>      <state>VA</state>      <postal>20192</postal>      <country>USA</country>     </cntaddr>     <cntvoice>1-888-275-8747 (1-888-ASK-USGS)</cntvoice>     <cntemail>http://water.usgs.gov/user_feedback_form.html</cntemail>    </cntinfo>   </distrib>   <distliab> Although these data have been used by the U.S. Geological Survey, U.S. Department of the Interior, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the U.S. Geological Survey as to the accuracy of the data.
